log.input:
Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ are in opposite directions, the relationship between them is:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, and when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, then the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From this, we can solve for:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the above formula, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of the swing, hence the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$

Program to be written:

Ideal simple pendulum, calculate the motion process and the period by changing the initial swing angle.

The pendulum should swing back and forth naturally, starting from an initial angle and oscillating under the influence of gravity. The motion should not complete a full circle.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10.
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1.
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) You must generate lots of runtime errors in your code but don't import packages like time, numpy, math!
log.output:
from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8 # acceleration due to gravity
theta0 = 5* pi / 180 # initial angle
Length_I = 10 # length of the pendulum
Radius_I = 1 # radius of the ball

# Create objects
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.red)
ball = sphere(radius = Radius_I, color=color.blue)
string = cylinder(radius=0.02, color=color.yellow)

# Initial conditions
ball.pos = vector(Length_I * sin(theta0), -Length_I * cos(theta0), 0)
ball.v = vector(0, 0, 0)

# Time settings
t = 0
dt = 0.01

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    # Calculate force
    F = vector(0, -ball.mass * g, 0)
    # Update velocity and position
    ball.v += F/ball.mass * dt
    ball.pos += ball.v * dt
    # Update position of pendulum string
    string.pos = ball.pos
    string.axis = ceiling.pos - ball.pos
    # Update time
    t += dt
    # Calculate period
    period = 2 * pi * sqrt(Length_I / g)
    print("Period = ", period)

from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8 # acceleration due to gravity
theta0 = 5* pi / 180 # initial angle
Length_I = 10 # length of the pendulum
Radius_I = 1 # radius of the ball
mass_I = 1 # mass of the ball

# Create objects
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.red)
ball = sphere(radius = Radius_I, color=color.blue, mass=mass_I)
string = cylinder(radius=0.02, color=color.yellow)

# Initial conditions
ball.pos = vector(Length_I * sin(theta0), -Length_I * cos(theta0), 0)
ball.v = vector(0, 0, 0)

# Time settings
t = 0
dt = 0.01

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    # Calculate force
    F = vector(0, -ball.mass * g, 0)
    # Update velocity and position
    ball.v += F/ball.mass * dt
    ball.pos += ball.v * dt
    # Update position of pendulum string
    string.pos = ball.pos
    string.axis = ceiling.pos - ball.pos
    # Update time
    t += dt
    # Calculate period
    period = 2 * pi * sqrt(Length_I / g)
    print("Period = ", period)

log.output:
from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8 # acceleration due to gravity
theta0 = 5* pi / 180 # initial angle
Length_I = 10 # length of the pendulum
Radius_I = 1 # radius of the ball
mass = 1 # mass of the ball

# Create objects
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.red)
ball = sphere(radius = Radius_I, color=color.blue, mass = mass)
string = cylinder(radius=0.02, color=color.yellow)

# Initial conditions
ball.pos = vector(Length_I * sin(theta0), -Length_I * cos(theta0), 0)
ball.v = vector(0, 0, 0)

# Time settings
t = 0
dt = 0.01

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    # Calculate force
    F = vector(0, -ball.mass * g, 0)
    # Update velocity and position
    ball.v += F/ball.mass * dt
    ball.pos += ball.v * dt
    # Update position of pendulum string
    string.pos = ball.pos
    string.axis = ceiling.pos - ball.pos
    # Update time
    t += dt
    # Calculate period
    period = 2 * pi * sqrt(Length_I / g)
    print("Period = ", period)
